isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - RANGE INHIBIT AND MODE SELECT LIGHT

svcproc.title: RANGE INHIBIT AND MODE SELECT LIGHT
svcproc.para: The RANGE INHIBIT AND MODE SELECT lights, located on the shifter or the dash panel, receive ignition voltage from the same source as the TCM. Circuit 13MA goes to connector (3044) and circuit 13MG goes to connector (3043).
The TCM provides a ground from grey TCM connector (3031) pin 23, on circuit 123 through TCM/Cab connector (3034), to connector (3044) pin B, causing the "Range Inhibit" light to illuminate.
The Mode select light is provided a ground from the cab ground through circuit 94-GC to ABS/Allison connector (377) and to connector (3043). The light is illuminated when the switch is activated.
